content.text:
# Quercus stewardiana

|genus = Quercus
|display_parents = 2
|parent = Quercus sect. Cyclobalanopsis
|species = stewardiana
|authority = A.Camus
|synonyms_ref =
|synonyms =
*Cyclobalanopsis stewardiana (A.Camus) Y.C.Hsu & H.Wei Jen
*Cyclobalanopsis stewardiana var. longicaudata Y.C.Hsu, P.I.Mao & W.Z.Li
}}
Quercus stewardiana is a species of tree in the beech family Fagaceae. It is widespread across much of China (Anhui, Guangdong, Guangxi, Guizhou, Hubei, Hunan, Jiangxi, Sichuan, Yunnan, Zhejiang).[http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon_id=210000408 Flora of China, Cyclobalanopsis stewardiana (A. Camus) Y. C. Hsu & H. W. Jen, 1979.  褐叶青冈 he ye qing gang ] It is placed in subgenus Cerris, section Cyclobalanopsis.
Quercus stewardiana is a tree up to 12 meters tall. Twigs are hairless. Leaves can be as much as 12 cm long, green on the top but white and waxy on the underside.
